org.gridgain.grid.spi.swapspace
Class GridSwapByteArray

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.spi.swapspace.GridSwapByteArray
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GridSwapByteArray
extends Object
implements Serializable

Utility wrapper class that represents byte array or a sub-array.

Constructor Detail

GridSwapByteArray

public GridSwapByteArray()
Creates uninitialized byte array wrapper.

GridSwapByteArray

public GridSwapByteArray(byte[] arr)
Creates byte array wrapper with given underlying base array. Note that in this case GridSwapByteArray.isEntire() will return true.

Parameters:
arr - Underlying base array. Note that offset will be set to 0 and length will be set to arr.length. Method isEntire() will return true.

GridSwapByteArray

public GridSwapByteArray(byte[] arr,
                         int off,
                         int len)
Creates byte sub-array wrapper with with given parameters.

Parameters:
arr - Underlying base array.
off - Non-negative offset in the array.
len - Non-negative length of the sub-array in the base array.
Method Detail

init

public void init(byte[] arr)
Initializes or re-initializes byte array wrapper with given underlying base array. Note that in this case GridSwapByteArray.isEntire() will return true.

Parameters:
arr - Underlying base array. Note that offset will be set to 0 and length will be set to arr.length. Method isEntire() will return true.

init

public void init(byte[] arr,
                 int off,
                 int len)
Initializes or re-initializes byte sub-array wrapper with with given parameters.

Parameters:
arr - Underlying base array.
off - Non-negative offset in the array.
len - Non-negative length of the sub-array in the base array.

isEntire

public boolean isEntire()
Tests whether or not this class wraps the entire array, i.e. offset is zero and length is equal to the length of the base array. If this method return true caller can simply use GridSwapByteArray.getArray() to get the array from this wrapper.

Returns:
Whether or not this class wraps the entire array.
See Also:
GridSwapByteArray.getAsEntire()

getAsEntire

public byte[] getAsEntire()
This method returns sub-array as an array. If method GridSwapByteArray.isEntire() returns true this method will not create new array and will return GridSwapByteArray.getArray() instead - otherwise the new byte array of GridSwapByteArray.getLength() length will be created, contents from the underlying base array will be copied, and resulting byte array will be returned.

Returns:
Wrapped sub-array as an array (making sure not to create extra byte array when unnecessary).

getArray

public byte[] getArray()
Gets underlying base array. If method GridSwapByteArray.isEntire() return true - this array represents the entire array.

Returns:
Underlying base array
See Also:
GridSwapByteArray.getAsEntire()

getOffset

public int getOffset()
Gets non-negative offset in the underlying base array.

Returns:
Non-negative offset in the underlying base array.

getLength

public int getLength()
Gets non-negative length in the underlying base array.

Returns:
Non-negative length in the underlying base array.
